Key Match Events: Mohammad Amir took 2-13 in his first international in four years.
Mohammad Rizwan led Pakistan to 92-3 in 12.1 overs with an unbeaten 45 off 34 balls.
Ben Lister made a spectacular two-handed diving catch off his follow through to dismiss Saim Ayub on 4 off the second ball of Pakistan's chase.
Mark Chapman top-scored with 19 as New Zealand was all out in 18.1 overs.
Amir took the pace off off his second delivery to Tim Robinson, who got the toe end of the bat and was caught at short cover in the second over.
New Zealand slipped to 35-3 inside the power play.
Leg-spinners Abrar Ahmed and Shadab Khan finished with identical figures of 2-15.
Afridi wrapped up the innings with his searing yorkers just after New Zealand passed its previous lowest T20 total of 80 against Pakistan in 2010 at Christchurch.
Pre-Game Insights: It’s crucial to set the tone in the first six overs in Rawalpindi, said Pakistan captain Babar Azam.
The way Naseem, Shaheen and Amir bowled, it was outstanding, said Babar Azam.
We try to play according to the conditions and execute our plans accordingly, said Babar Azam.
We want to do well in all departments and work on it on a daily basis, said Babar Azam.
Post-Match Reflections: We didn’t score quite enough runs, said New Zealand skipper Michael Bracewell.
We were a little bit slow to adapt to the surface and put ourselves under pressure in the end, said Michael Bracewell.
We got a game tomorrow and we need to learn quickly, said Michael Bracewell.
We pride ourselves in fighting right till the end (and) we did that with the ball and in the field, said Michael Bracewell.
Miscellaneous Highlights: In the absence of nine frontline players at the Indian Premier League, New Zealand struggled to cope with Pakistan's experienced bowling attack.
